org.brickred.socialauth.android
Class SocialAuthAdapter

java.lang.Object
  org.brickred.socialauth.android.SocialAuthAdapter

public class SocialAuthAdapter
extends java.lang.Object

Main class of the SocialAuth Android SDK. Wraps a user interface component with the SocialAuth functionality of updating status, getting user profiles, contacts, upload images, get user feeds, get user albums on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, MySpace, Yahoo, Google FourSquare, Runkeeper, SalesForce and Yammer.
Currently it can be used in four different ways. First, it can be attached with a Button that user may click. Clicking will open a menu with various social networks listed that the user can click on. Clicking on any network opens a dialog for authentication with that social network. Once the user is authenticated, you can use various methods from the AuthProvider interface to update status, get profile, contacts, user feeds, album feeds and upload images.
Secondly, it can be attached to a LinearLayout for creating a Bar with several buttons, one for each social network. Clicking on these icons will open a dialog which will authenticate the user and one the user is authenticated, you can use various methods from the AuthProvider interface to update status, get profile, contacts, user feeds, album feeds and upload images.
Thirdly, it can be used as shareactionprovider in actionbar.. Clicking on it it will show list of all providers along with other apps which are use by ACTION_SEND intent. The socialauth providers will be shown is added else it will default application. For example if you added socialauth facebook provider then it will show socialauth facebook provider else it will show default facebook application.
Lastly, you can just launch the authentication dialog directly from any event you prefer. Examples for all of these ways is provided in the examples directory of the SocialAuth Android SDK

Author:
vineet.aggarwal@3pillarglobal.com, abhinav.maheswari@3pillarglobal.com
